subject: Relationships
title: Love Languages in the Modern World
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Love Languages in the Modern World.

hook.text: Gary Chapman's 'Five Love Languages' has sold 20 million copies. Everyone wants to decode how they love.

buildup.text: The five languages: words of affirmation, acts of service, gifts, quality time, and physical touch.

discovery.text: Couples who learn each other's love language report 60% higher satisfaction in their relationships.

twist.text: Critics argue love languages oversimplify. Real love is messy and doesn't fit neatly into five categories.

climax.text: Love languages aren't perfect science. But they gave millions a vocabulary for needs they couldn't express.

punchline.text: Love languages aren't science â€” they're a conversation starter.

quiz.question: How many love languages did Gary Chapman identify?
